item.title: Road collapsing AGAIN Dunalley Street, 4th December
item.description:
Road has collapsed in Dunalley Street outside Glenhurst Villa, Dunalley Street, Cheltenham GL50 4AP This is one of the areas which keeps collapsing and being patched up

item.title: Conditional Sign Missing, 4th December
item.description:
Sign depicting rules regarding no right turn that hung from the bar missing. It restricted turning right for any vehicle except cyclists between 07:30 and 09:30 daily.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): White Gables Mill Street, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 Millcourt Flats Idsall Drive, Prestbury

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle on Leighton Road, 4th December
item.description:
This vehicle has been left on Leighton Road since early September. The vehicle has some significant damage to the front left area, which presumably is the result of a road traffic collision. The vehicle is taking up badly needed parking space for residents, but more pertinently appears to have been dumped as no one has been to it since it was left here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 37 Leighton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tyres and gas pipes have been fly tipped, 2nd December
item.description:
They are in the brook and at the farmers field entrance and will result in flooding of the road if not cleared
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3 The Elms Badgeworth Road, The Reddings

item.title: Dead tree hanging over the road, 2nd December
item.description:
The location is the left hand side of Mill Lane going towards Glenfall Hotel. A tree was hit by a van and part of it fell into the road and was moved aside. However, the remainder is hanging a bit precariously over the road and could come down anytime and especially if clipped again by a high side vehicle. Please could this be cleared away and the rest of the length of that particular part of Mill Lane be checked for any other trees which may present a problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes near junction of Lime Ct, 1st December
item.description:
There re several potholes in this area approx 4 which are becoming a real problem as they are deep and multiple holes. This area has been repaired in the past but continues to break up and this particular section needs to be resurfaced or something other than patch fixing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Grove Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement/no entry, 29th November
item.description:
This has been going on for over a decade, the problem is Badham pharmacy, the pavement was so bad due to cars driving onto the pavement three cars abreast then vans and very large vans and cars ignoring the no entry sign driving onto the pavement to deliver goods or collect prescriptions, I have many times contacted Libs, labour, conservative, greens, to no avail..more.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 3-5 Prestbury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leak from The Swan causing surface water, 29th November
item.description:
For some time there has been a substantial water leak from The Swan pub that flows down the top of The Wharf road. With the cold weather this is now freezing on the road surface causing potential danger to vehicles using the lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Old Police House The Wharf, Coombe Hill
Report on FixMyStreet
